âœ… é¡ºåºè¡¨ï¼ˆä½¿ç”¨ std::vectorï¼‰

#include <iostream>
#include <vector>
using namespace std;

int main() {
    vector<int> seqList;

    // æ’å…¥å…ƒç´ 
    seqList.push_back(10);
    seqList.push_back(20);
    seqList.push_back(30);

    // åˆ é™¤å…ƒç´ ï¼ˆåˆ é™¤ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªï¼‰
    seqList.erase(seqList.begin() + 1);

âœ… é“¾è¡¨ï¼ˆè‡ªå®šä¹‰å•å‘é“¾è¡¨ï¼‰

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

struct Node {
    int data;
    Node* next;
    Node(int val) : data(val), next(nullptr) {}
};

void insert(Node*& head, int val) {
    Node* newNode = new Node(val);
    newNode->next = head;
    head = newNode;
}

void deleteNode(Node*& head, int val) {
    Node* curr = head;
    Node* prev = nullptr;
    while (curr) {
        if (curr->data == val) {
            if (prev) prev->next = curr->next;
            else head = curr->next;
            delete curr;
            return;
        }
        prev = curr;
        curr = curr->next;
    }
}

void printList(Node* head) {
    int index = 0;
    while (head) {
        cout << "é“¾è¡¨å…ƒç´ [" << index++ << "] = " << head->data << endl;
        head = head->next;
    }
}

int main() {
    Node* head = nullptr;

    // æ’å…¥å…ƒç´ ï¼ˆå¤´æ’æ³•ï¼‰
    insert(head, 30);
    insert(head, 20);
    insert(head, 10);

    // åˆ é™¤å…ƒç´ ï¼ˆåˆ é™¤å€¼ä¸º 20 çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼‰
    deleteNode(head, 20);

    // æ‰“å°é“¾è¡¨
    printList(head);

    return 0;
}

item.title: æ•°åˆ— Array
item.description:
Week 10

array function

#include<iostream>
#include<cmath>
using namespace std;

/* 
looking for prime within 100.
Sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm
*/

int main()
{
    int sum=0, a[100]={0};
    for(int i=2;i<sqrt(100.0);i++) // outer loop for i[2,9]
    {
        sum=i;
        while(sum<100)// inner loop for sum[2,99]
        {
            sum=sum+i;
            if(sum<100)
            a[sum]=1; // why = ?
        }
    }
    for(int i=2;i<100;i++)
    {
        if(a[i]==0)cout<<i<<" "; // why == ?
        
    }

    cout<<""<<endl;

	return 0;
}

when a[i] = {9, 15} , how could we calculate and remove it from the array a[n]?

cinÂ operator automatically skips any whitespace, including spaces and newlines. itâ€™s illegal to use â€œ â€ with cin, because it is string literal, cin could not hold string.

item.title: è®¡ç®—å¯¼è®ºä¸Cè¯­è¨€åŸºç¡€
item.description:
åŸè¯¾ç¨‹é“¾æ¥ï¼šè®¡ç®—å¯¼è®ºä¸Cè¯­è¨€åŸºç¡€

Turing machine

The ranking is in descending order of price and working speed

  • Register: carries operation data and results, as fast as a CPU
  • Cache: data buffer
  • Memory: the part that cannot be placed in the CPU
  • External memory (hard disk, USB flash drive)

C. Bohm & G. Jacopini, “Flow Diagrams, Turing Machines and Languages â€‹â€‹with Only Two Formations Rules”, Communications of ACM, vol9(5) May 1966, pp 366-371.

Everything in the world is complicated, and there are only three kinds of logic expressed in programs:
